com.j2speed.async
Interface AsyncExecutor

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.concurrent.Executor
All Known Implementing Classes:
ReentrantExecutor
public interface AsyncExecutor
extends java.util.concurrent.Executor

The Executor specialisation for use in and AsyncRunner.

A contract that must be satisfied by implementations, is that they have to be reentrant relatively to the threads they own. To be more specific, if a thread used by an implementation to run tasks tries to reuse the executor to execute another task, the executor should use the current thread instead of going through the normal scheduling path.

This contract is required to avoid thread exhaustion deadlocks that could arise when using certain recursive execution patterns are used.

Author:
Alex Nistico <alienisty(at)gmail.com>

execute
 

Method Detail

cancel

boolean cancel(java.lang.Runnable task)
Removes the specified task from the execution queue of this executor.

This method returns whether the task was successfully removed or not. If the method returns true, it means that the task was in the queue and it was not yet polled for running, therefore, if this method returns true, the specified task will never start, unless it is submitted again to the executor.

Parameters:
task - the Runnable to cancel.
Returns:
true if the task was still in the queue, false if the task was no longer in the queue.

cancelPendings

@NonNull
java.util.List<java.lang.Runnable> cancelPendings()
Cancels all pending tasks.

Returns:
a list of all tasks that were in the queue when called.

shutdown

void shutdown()
Attempts to stop all actively executing asyncs, halts the processing of waiting asyncs.

There are no guarantees beyond best-effort attempts to stop processing actively executing tasks. Typical implementations will cancel via Thread.interrupt(), so any task that fails to respond to interrupts may never terminate.

Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and shutting down this AsyncExecutor may manipulate threads that the caller is not permitted to modify because it does not hold RuntimePermission ("modifyThread"), or the security manager's checkAccess method denies access.
